intro: Tylostemon foliosus, commonly known as the slender-leaved tylostemon, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, fragrant white flowers that appear in clusters. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in coastal areas. Tylostemon foliosus is often found in open forests and heathlands, where it thrives in full sun.
